messages.subject: Re:ok it done
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/29/2003 7:05:33 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Dee, you wonderful, loving Mom!!!!!!! She probably IS considered to need special permission.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/29/2003 7:05:33 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Ok it is done.
> I got yet another call from the school today. First from the office
> asking why I allowed both my girls to stay home yesterday and spend
> the day with me. I informed them that with my work sec. it was the
> only time I had to see them, and entire family took days off work
> ext. write them down excused parent or sick (call it mommy iddess,
> witch ever I didn't care)
> Then the next was from my Daughter in tears again. We had gotten
> her hair cut yesterday and the girls where making fun of her writing
> on the bathroom walls and so forth. Even threatened to kill her again
> and beat her up, for getting her hair cut.
> I had had it. Daughter wanted to come home I told them release her
> they said just because she is being picked on .I told them for get it
> I will be right there. I met daughter in hall and said you sure you
> want to do this now she said please mom. We marched into the
> superintendent's office asked for the paper work was asked why and I
> re told them why. They gave me the paper work and we went to the
> locker and cleaned it out. Turned in the books and said we are done.
> So now here is my dilemma on the paper work it says I have to
> have special permission it reads:
> No. #8. If the child is currently identified as a child requiring in
> special education prior approval must be sought from the special
> education director at the Area Education Agency if this is the first
> year that the child will be receiving Competent Privet instruction in
> Iowa. Iowa code section 200A.9
> If she had a IEP is she one that needs special permission?
> I told her she didn't have to go back. And I will not lie to her.
> Next Monday is nest day during the day I have off and will make a
> trip to the homeschool in Kolona and see if I can transfer her there,
> and bypass it all. But thought I would inform here to progress. And
> ask for advice.
> Dee
>

Dee, you wonderful, loving Mom!!!!!!!

She probably IS considered to need special permission. What kind of
relationship do you have with the SPED people? Maybe it won't be a big deal.
If it seems to be, I'd consider going right to the Superintendent. It's so
close to the end of the school year it might not even be a problem.

Keep us posted, and let us know if you need help.
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
